intro: Pedicularis laevicaulis, commonly known as the smooth lady's slipper, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its showy, slipper-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. Its unique morphology and ecological niche make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
